article.headline: Portland 89, Florida Atlantic 75
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. -- Jared Stohl scored 24 points to lead Portland to an 89-75 victory over Florida Atlantic in the final game of the Athletes in Action Classic on Sunday. Luke Sikma, the tournament's most valuable player, added 15 points and tied a career high with 19 rebounds for Portland (3-0). Greg Gantt had 20 points and Raymond Taylor 18 for the Owls (2-1). The Pilots shot 28 of 54 (52 percent) and hit 9 of 20 3-pointers. It was close early before Portland rattled off 10 unanswered points to take a 40-29 lead. The Pilots led 42-34 at halftime, then opened the second half on a 14-3 run. Florida Atlantic twice closed the deficit to 11, the last time at 76-65 with 4:45 left. But the Pilots responded with eight straight points to put the game out reach. Kramer Knutson had 16 points and seven rebounds, and Eric Waterford scored 13.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
